description: Daily horse care, feeding, grooming, and stable maintenance knowledge

knowledge_chunks.content: Horses need 2-3% of body weight in feed daily, split into 2-3 meals. Feeding times should be consistent - horses thrive on routine.
Daily grooming includes brushing, hoof picking, and health checks. Proper grooming strengthens bond with horses and allows health monitoring.
Turnout schedule depends on weather, horse temperament, and paddock availability. Individual horses have different needs based on age and activity level.
Fresh water must be available at all times, check automatic waterers daily. Signs of illness include changes in appetite, behavior, or manure consistency.
Stalls need daily mucking, fresh bedding as needed. Equipment maintenance is crucial for safety and efficiency.
Stalls should be mucked out daily. Remove wet bedding and manure, add fresh bedding as needed.
Horses drink 5-10 gallons of water daily. Check water buckets twice daily and ensure clean, fresh water.
Good hay is green, sweet-smelling, and free from dust and mold. Avoid hay that's brown, musty, or has visible mold.
Common bedding includes straw, wood shavings, and pelleted bedding. Each has different absorption and cost benefits.
Feed should be stored in sealed containers away from moisture. Check for pests and expired feed regularly.
Most horses benefit from daily turnout. Check fencing and gates before releasing horses to pasture.
